answers.answer: Cramping is normal after an internal.
Arh thats good to no :) its such a worry being pregnant lol thank u
If you start to have spotting, that's normal too.
I've been feeling crampy and pressure after my internals.   Last week I even had a little spotting. It's normal
Im 39+2 thats why i asked the question coz im waiting for labour to start lol
How did they check ur fluid i havnt been offered such check up getting worried now.

I had to go hospital yesturday coz my babys movement had changed so they monitored me for 20 minutes and coz i mentioned that i was leaking watery fluid they done an internal to check fluid round baby wasnt leaking which it isnt but also give me a scan to check blood flow to placenta was good but coz baby has extra fluid round him i had to have blood test to check ive not developed diabetes so waiting for results and gota go for another scan next week to check fluid again
Oh ok thnx good luck dear..
If you're having a healthy pregnancy there is no reason to have internals. Even during labor. I'm simply refusing to have one if theirs no medical/alarming reason

question: I had an internal today to check fluid round my baby and now i have a really sharp pain in my lower belly just above my vagina hurts more when im standing or walking just want to no if any of u ladies have had an internal an than had this pain?
title: pains!
